alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 04 at 11:20PM CDT until July 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR EASTERN MORRIS...SOUTHERN WABAUNSEE...OSAGE AND NORTHERN LYON COUNTIES... At 1119 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Dover to near Allen to 5 miles northwest of Strong City, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Emporia, Osage City, Council Grove, Carbondale, Eskridge, Overbrook, Lyndon, Burlingame, Americus, Scranton, Alta Vista, Harveyville, Reading, Allen, Admire, Bushong, Dunlap, Council Grove Lake and Volland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 near mile marker 129, and between mile markers 138 and 143. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 128 and 165. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
